title: Facebook Takes Down Trading Group With 157,000 Members Amid GameStop Frenzy
text: Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB) disabled a 157,000-member trading discussion group on its platform that discussed shares of companies like GameStop Corporation (NYSE: GME) and others, Reuters reported Thursday. What Happened: The group — Robinhood Stock Traders — was created by Allen Tran, a 23-year old who was notified by the social network giant that it had been taken down for violating policies on “adult sexual exploitation,” according to Reuters.

title: Mr. Market Continues Mispricing Facebook, And Q4 Proved It
text: Facebook's earnings proved that its user and ARPU growth remain robust. The stock remains incredibly undervalued both from future earnings and future free cash flow perspective.

title: Facebook Is Now the Market's Most Undervalued Growth Stock — And It's Going to $400
text: FB stock is arguably the only high-quality growth stock in the market that is still significantly undervalued. The post Facebook Is Now the Market's Most Undervalued Growth Stock — And It's Going to $400 appeared first on InvestorPlace.

title: Apple's Tim Cook criticizes social media practices, intensifying Facebook conflict
text: Apple Inc Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook on Thursday criticized polarization and misinformation on social media, intensifying a conflict between the iPhone maker and Facebook Inc.

title: Facebook's (FB) Q4 Earnings Beat Estimates, Revenues Up Y/Y
text: Facebook's (FB) fourth-quarter performance gains from robust ad revenues and user-base expansion in international markets.

title: The Ratings Game: Facebook's strong quarter raises social-media stocks
text: Neither the growing threat of Apple Inc. as its chief competitor nor a raging pandemic could derail the revenue runaway train that is Facebook Inc. And Snap Inc. and Twitter Inc. are benefiting in strong trading Thursday.

title: Apple CEO links Facebook's business model to real-world violence
text: "If a business is built on misleading users, on data exploitation, on choices that are no choices at all, it does not deserve our praise. It deserves scorn"

title: 'Growth Stock At Value Multiple': Facebook Analysts React To Q4 Numbers
text: Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) shares ticked slightly higher Thursday after the company reported impressive fourth-quarter earnings numbers. Facebook reported adjusted earnings per share of $3.88, beating consensus analyst estimates of $3.22.

title: Facebook (FB) Trading Higher After Strong Quarter
text: Facebook (FB) political headwinds are receding, allowing ad revenue to dictate price action.

title: Facebook: Strong Q4, Mid-Teens Annualized Return Ahead; Buy
text: We review FB's Q4 2020 results released overnight; shares were down 10% at one point in post-market trading, and finished at 2.3% down. Ad revenue growth accelerated to 31% in Q4, driven by the number of ads rising 25% and average price rising for the first time in 2020.

title: Factbox: Here's what Facebook's oversight board says the company should do
text: Facebook Inc's independent oversight board made its first binding decisions on Thursday, overruling the company's actions in four of the five cases it reviewed. https://www.oversightboard.com/news/165523235084273-announcing-the-oversight-board-s-first-case-decisions

title: Facebook oversight board overrules company on most cases in first test
text: Deciding its first cases, Facebook Inc's oversight board ruled on Thursday that the social media company was wrong to remove four of five pieces of content the board reviewed, including posts Facebook took down for violating rules on hate speech and harmful COVID-19 misinformation.

title: UK regulator launches probe into Facebook's purchase of Giphy
text: The watchdog is assessing whether the Facebook-Giphy deal will reduce competition in the supply of video clips and animated images.

title: UK's competition watchdog still eyeing Facebook's Giphy buy
text: The UK's competition regulator will make a decision on whether or not Facebook's acquisition of Giphy has a ‘realistic prospect' of substantially lessening competition by March 25, it said today, as it continues to scrutinize the deal. “The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) hereby gives notice pursuant to paragraph (b) of the definition of ‘initial […]

title: Mark Zuckerberg said Apple is becoming Facebook's biggest competitor. He also accused Apple of misleading users on privacy and abusing its dominance.
text: Facebook's CEO Mark Zuckerberg attacked Apple during Facebook's quarterly earnings call on Wednesday. Zuckerberg talked up Facebook's suite of messaging apps, lauding their privacy practices. He then segued into criticizing Apple, saying it makes "misleading" privacy promises to consumers while offering a messaging service, iMessage, that has less privacy than Facebook-owned WhatsApp.
